articles.title: Harvard Study: Eating Dark Chocolate Could Reduce Your Risk of Diabetes by 21% - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Dark chocolate consumption may lower the risk of type 2 diabetes by 21%, while milk chocolate does not show similar benefits, according to a Harvard study. A new study from Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health suggests that consuming dark chocolate, but …
articles.content: Participants who ate at least five servings of chocolate weekly had a 10% reduced risk of type 2 diabetes (T2D), with dark chocolate showing an even stronger effect—a 21% lower risk. In contrast, mil… [+3905 chars]
